name: Lacticum acidum
Relationship: Compare: SARCOLACTIC ACID Q.V. LITHIA; PHOS-AC.

Stomach: Burning, hot gas from stomach to throat, causing profuse secretion of tenacious mucus, worse smoking
Nausea; morning sickness, especially in pale anaemic women
Chest: Pain in breasts, with enlargement of axillary glands, and pain extends into hand
Throat: Fullness or lump like a puff ball
Extremities: Rheumatic pain in joints and shoulders, wrists, knees, with much weakness
Trembling of whole body while walking

details: Morning sickness, DIABETES, and rheumatism offer a field for this remedy. TROUBLES IN THE BREASTS. Locally, in the tuberculous ulceration of vocal cords.
dosage: Third to thirtieth potency. Six to ten drops in a small glass of water in acute gastroenteritis (Cartier.).
